text:
EASA proposes flight recorders to have extended underwater duration and detection range.   
http://t.co/0jJKuWsQUT

http://t.co/Wz682S8Vg5

http://t.co/eFtFXXMQo1: stay tuned…! http://t.co/OkWgnL5FyY

EC175 certification: technical process completed. EASA Type Certificate to be handed-over to Airbus Helicopters in the first quarter of 2014
Operational Suitability Data rules are published: all data necessary to safely operate aircraft is now available http://t.co/vv8L3LjGht
Patrick Ky, EASA Executive Director, spoke today to @EP_Transport  on safety priorities for air transport in Europe.
2013 was the safest year in commercial aviation. Statistics show improvements in safety.http://t.co/78rJTztGwR
EASA is seeking to recruit a Safety Investigation Officer. Deadline for sending applications: 17/01/2014. https://t.co/JJmSKdQgZd
Airlines can now allow the use of electronic devices in Flight or Airplane Mode during taxiing, take-off and landing http://t.co/uGAeWXxET9
EASA allows use of Electronic Devices on board during all phases of flight as long as the devices are in Flight Mode. http://t.co/HXJrTewNAv
The European Aviation Safety Plan (EASp) Summit has started! 36 experts from 26 National Aviation Authorities. Focus on coordination.
RT @ATCA_now: Patrick Ky accepts the 2013 Glen A. Gilbert Memorial Award! Says he dreamed of being in aviation since he was 6. http://t.co/…
Patrick Ky receives top award from the Air Traffic Control Association ATCA.
EASA welcomes the adoption by the European Parliament of the European Commission proposal to harmonise flight and duty time limitations FTL
EASA and Transport Canada enhance their cooperation in Aviation Safety http://t.co/O4jB9UDy6s
EASA is present at #Helitech starting today in London to discuss the place of the rotorcraft industry in the European regulatory system.
Ice is a serious aviation safety issue. EASA conference on icing on 15 & 16 October 2013 - Cologne. Registration http://t.co/TqR2Oh2wvr
Patrick Ky participated in the meeting of EU transport Ministers in Vilnius to comment on the proposed legislative SES2+ package.
EASA approved the latest upgrade of the Rolls-Royce Trent 1000 engines.
Mr. Patrick Ky took over as Executive Director of the European Aviation Safety Agency on September 1, 2013. http://t.co/XyTuQh1XtZ
Register now for the seventh EASA Rotorcraft Symposium, which will be held on 4th and 5th December 2013. http://t.co/S8ki8wprjI

EASA today approved the design change of the Boeing 787-8 Auxiliary Power Unit battery, battery charger and battery enclosure

EASA @ EBACE. Today is the last chance to visit us at stand 2332 in Hall 5.
Today, open, frank & friendly talks between EASA and representatives of pilots & cabin crew outside of EASA building: safety first, always.
EASA grants initial type certificate to Airbus Military for the A400M

22/03/2012: a major milestone towards the Certification of the #A400M - all propulsion products and appliances are now EASA certified.

annotations.normalized_text: Type Certificate of the Sukhoi Superjet 100 to Sukhoi Civil Aircraft Company

text: Patrick Goudou officially handed over the Type Certificate of the Sukhoi Superjet 100 to Sukhoi Civil Aircraft Company.

5th EASA rotorcraft symposium today in Cologne; participation of more than 250 international helicopters experts

Boeing 787-8 is set for EASA certification. Type will enter into service later this year with All Nippon Airways.
EASA certifies Boeing 747-8F - type is set to enter service with Cargolux later this year.
Official adoption of the ‘ATCO Regulation’, the first Implementing Rule from EASA’s second extension!

Peter Bunce, President of GAMA @ EASA today

International Collaboration Group on Safety Management Systems talked today about harmonising international SMS requirements for aviation.

actively contributing in clarifying the situation following the incident involving a Qantas Airbus A380 on 04.11.2010. http://bit.ly/ayWycx

ILA Berlin: visit EASA at the recruitment fair
Vice-President Kallas, in charge of transport, and his team visited EASA. VP Kallas emphasised the role of EASA in the Single European Sky.
